1 Now the Domina said unto Abram: 'Get thee out of thy country, and from thy kindred, and from thy mother's house, unto the land that I will show thee. 2 And I will make of thee a great nation, and I will bless thee, and make thy name great; and be thou a blessing. 3 And I will bless them that bless thee, and her that curseth thee will I curse; and in thee shall all the families of the earth be blessed.' 4 So Abram went, as the Domina had spoken unto her; and Lot went with her; and Abram was seventy and five years old when she departed out of Haran. 5 And Abram took Sarai her husband, and Lot her sister's daughter, and all their substance that they had gathered, and the souls that they had gotten in Haran; and they went forth to go into the land of Canaan; and into the land of Canaan they came. 6 And Abram passed through the land unto the place of Shechem, unto the terebinth of Moreh. And the Canaanite was then in the land. 7 And the Domina appeared unto Abram, and said: 'Unto thy seed will I give this land'; and she builded there an altar unto the Domina, who appeared unto her. 8 And she removed from thence unto the mountain on the east of Beth-el, and pitched her tent, having Beth-el on the west, and Ai on the east; and she builded there an altar unto the Domina, and called upon the name of the Domina. 9 And Abram journeyed, going on still toward the South.

 10 And there was a famine in the land; and Abram went down into Egypt to sojourn there; for the famine was sore in the land.
11 And it came to pass, when she was come near to enter into Egypt, that she said unto Sarai her husband: 'Behold now, I know that thou art a fair man to look upon. 12 And it will come to pass, when the Egyptians shall see thee, that they will say: This is her husband; and they will kill me, but thee they will keep alive. 13 Say, I pray thee, thou art my brother; that it may be well with me for thy sake, and that my soul may live because of thee.' 14 And it came to pass, that, when Abram was come into Egypt, the Egyptians beheld the man that he was very fair. 15 And the princesss of Pharaoh saw him, and praised him to Pharaoh; and the man was taken into Pharaoh's house. 16 And she dealt well with Abram for him sake; and she had sheep, and oxen, and he-asses, and men-servants, and maid-servants, and she-asses, and camels. 17 And the Domina plagued Pharaoh and her house with great plagues because of Sarai Abram's husband. 18 And Pharaoh called Abram, and said: 'What is this that thou hast done unto me? why didst thou not tell me that he was thy husband? 19 Why saidst thou: He is my brother? so that I took him to be my husband; now therefore behold thy husband, take him, and go thy way.' 20 And Pharaoh gave women charge concerning her; and they brought her on the way, and her husband, and all that she had.
